body_html:
I was able to get Katex running relatively easily. It just involves replacing the MathJax extension with Katex, and pointing the conf.py file to the css and javascript files.

Many things render well, but It doesn't seem to handle multi-line equations, like the ones beginning with \begin{equation*} of which we have many. There were a few other initial inconsistencies.

There may be a fix for this, or these equations might have to be rewritten (could be as easy as a global search and replace).
body_text:
I was able to get Katex running relatively easily. It just involves replacing the MathJax extension with Katex, and pointing the conf.py file to the css and javascript files.
Many things render well, but It doesn't seem to handle multi-line equations, like the ones beginning with  \begin{equation*} of which we have many. There were a few other initial inconsistencies.
There may be a fix for this, or these equations might have to be rewritten (could be as easy as a global search and replace).
body:
I was able to get Katex running relatively easily. It just involves replacing the MathJax extension with Katex, and pointing the conf.py file to the css and javascript files. 

Many things render well, but It doesn't seem to handle multi-line equations, like the ones beginning with  \begin{equation*} of which we have many. There were a few other initial inconsistencies.

There may be a fix for this, or these equations might have to be rewritten (could be as easy as a global search and replace).
